results.title: Handling angry customers over the phone
results.brief_description: Angry customers may be found in any business. This instructive video portrays three business settings; telemarketing, the computer industry and an accounts department; all feature an angry customer over the phone. The scenarios depict a variety of conflicting reactions such as aggression and passivity. As a response to the scenarios the video provides key concepts such as; rational rather than emotional responses, positive rather than negative phrases, assertive as opposed to passive, active listening skills and the importance of a supportive work environment.

results.title: Handling and preserving family records
results.creator_credit: Rodney Crouch, James S. Cable and Cable Crouch Productions
results.brief_description: Presented by a range of conservation experts from the British Public Records office, this program looks at the handling and storage of family documents, books, textiles, photographs, films, recorded tapes and military memorabilia, to avoid deterioration. The use of acid free containers, correct temperature control and ventilation, transport methods as well as information about materials and cleaning practices likely to damage family heirlooms are shown.

results.title: Handling and care of the patient
results.brief_description:
Episode number 11 of Series “The Technique of anaesthesia”.
Intended for the instruction of nurses and porters as well as medical students, this film deals with the general care of the patient before, during, and after anaesthesia.

results.title: Handle with care: packaging
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Hughes and Shell Film Unit
results.brief_description: The object of this film is to show the stresses and strains packages have to withstand and point out the need for care and attention when handling them. An actual packing case is followed from despatch to consignee, involving transport by sea and road and exposure to weather. Emphasises that the actual expense incurred in repairing damaged packages, although amounting to many thousands of pounds, is trifling compared to the loss of the customer’s goodwill.

results.title: Handle with Care
results.creator_credit: Andrena Finlay, Anna Landa and Paul Cox
results.brief_description: This film sensitively follows two women who have been diagnosed with breast cancer. Using a docu-drama format, the program explains methods of self-examination, reaction to diagnosis, options of treatment available and the emotional demands and needs which arise from a positive diagnosis.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Andrena Finlay, Anna Landa and Paul Cox

results.title: Handle with care
results.brief_description: Shows the various processes involved in the production of a modern long-playing record from the recording session to the final disc. The importance of quality control is emphasised at each stage of the process. Includes cutting the acetate disc from the tape, processing of the acetate disc to give the final stamper, and the stamping of records from a mixture of polymer, stabilizer and carbon black.

results.title: Handicrafts of Japan
results.creator_credit: dentsu and Japan. National Tourist Organisation
results.brief_description: A survey of the traditional handicrafts of Japan. Crafts shown in some detail are the hand painting of costumes and features; spinning and dyeing of thread for home weaving; the making of bamboo baskets, paper lanterns and decorated paper fans. Examples of clay pottery of all shapes, sizes and design with intricate and skilful glazing and decoration is also presented.

results.title: Handicrafts of India (Travancore)
results.creator_credit: A. Bhaskar Rao, Ezra Mir and Films Division, Government of India
results.brief_description: Leaves of tress, buffalo horns and multi-colored sand and shells from the beach at Cape Comorin are some of the simple materials which the gifted craftsmen of Travancore deftly turn into beautiful and fascinating handicrafts. The film also shows lace manufacture depicting the work of the men, women and children of Travancore.

results.title: Handicrafts of India
results.creator_credit: Krishna Gopal, Ezra Mir and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: Deals with the woodcarving, papiermache and shawl-weaving of Kashmir, the metalwork of Uttar-Pradesh, and the marble modelling of Jaipur.

results.title: Handicrafts instructional films. No. 4. Loom weaving
results.brief_description: In this film we are able to observe one of the students of the Universal School of Handicrafts, USA, threading a small loom, and, following a weaving draft, weaving a pattern.
